meanings.definition: A person who consistently makes mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is known as the foozlers in our group because he often forgets his homework.
meanings.sent2: The new employee turned out to be a foozlers, constantly mixing up orders.
meanings.sent3: The foozlers accidentally put salt instead of sugar in the coffee, creating a salty surprise for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother is a real foozlers, turning every simple task into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent5: The foozlers left a trail of misplaced keys and forgotten appointments wherever they went.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: Please don't foozlers the important presentation by forgetting your notes.
meanings.sent2: I foozlersed the recipe by adding too much salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent3: She foozlersed her way through the dance routine, but still managed to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The team cannot afford to foozlers this crucial opportunity for success.
meanings.sent5: If you foozlers the directions, you might end up lost in the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of making a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: The foozlers of the chef resulted in a burnt souffle for dessert.
meanings.sent2: Her constant foozlers in math class led to a lower grade than expected.
meanings.sent3: The foozlers of the magician turned the rabbit into a hat instead of pulling it out.
meanings.sent4: The foozlers of the student caused the experiment to explode in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's foozlers on stage had the audience roaring with laughter.
